H0.text: Iron is the element that causes soil to appear red, as soil color is closely related to its content.

H1.text: Silicon is the element that causes soil to appear red, since soil color is closely related to its content.

H2.text: Calcium causes soil to appear red because soil color is closely related to its content.

H3.text: Magnesium is the element that causes soil to appear red because soil color is closely related to its content.

A4.text: Red colors often indicate iron accumulation or oxidation in oxygen-rich, well-aerated soils.

A5.text: White colors are common in soils with salt, carbonate, or calcite accumulations, which often occur in arid environments.
